Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified distinct patterns in temperature, vibration, material flow, and tool position to group events into potential phases of a manufacturing process.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyzed events 1-3 and 13-15 with consistent low readings across all attributes, concluding these periods represent 'Idle/Standby' states.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Inferred that high vibration, temperature, material flow, and energy usage in events 4-6 indicate 'Cutting Metal,' matching typical characteristics of such activity.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Observed that events 7-8 exhibit moderate temperature, higher pressure, slower material flow, and static tool position. Concluded this phase represents 'Assembling Parts.'

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Interpreted event 9's high temperatures, vibration, and energy usage with no material flow as a 'Welding' operation since this aligns with typical welding characteristics.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Noted event 10's drop in temperature, minimal vibration, and no material flow, interpreting it as 'Quality Inspection' based on general manufacturing practices, though with insufficient direct evidence.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Connected events 11-12's slow material flow, slight vibration, and advancing tool position to 'Packaging,' correlating with movements needed to finalize products.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Reevaluated all grouped activities by checking the consistency of assigned labels against the sensor data patterns and the logical sequence of a manufacturing process.
